ci_support_linux_64_python3.10.____cpyth:
c_compiler:
- gcc
c_compiler_version:
- '14'
c_stdlib:
- sysroot
c_stdlib_version:
- '2.17'
channel_sources:
- conda-forge
channel_targets:
- conda-forge main
docker_image:
- quay.io/condaforge/linux-anvil-x86_64:alma9
pin_run_as_build:
  python:
    min_pin: x.x
    max_pin: x.x
python:
- 3.10.* *_cpython
target_platform:
- linux-64

about.description:
WESTPA is a package for constructing and running stochastic simulations
using the "weighted ensemble" approach of Huber and Kim (1996).
about.summary: Interoperable, highly-scalable software for weighted ensemble simulation.

about.description:
WESTPA is a package for constructing and running stochastic simulations
using the "weighted ensemble" approach of Huber and Kim (1996).
about.summary: Interoperable, highly-scalable software for weighted ensemble simulation.

name: westpa

about.description:
WESTPA is a package for constructing and running stochastic simulations
using the "weighted ensemble" approach of Huber and Kim (1996).
about.summary: Interoperable, highly-scalable software for weighted ensemble simulation.

about.description:
WESTPA is a package for constructing and running stochastic simulations
using the "weighted ensemble" approach of Huber and Kim (1996).
about.summary: Interoperable, highly-scalable software for weighted ensemble simulation.

raw_meta_yaml:
schema_version: 1

context:
  name: westpa
  version: 2022.13
  sha256: 19194d078f1f5b8b32c7fe9e5ed1106d3f95b56bacd759c885cf0a160f798591

package:
  name: ${{ name|lower }}
  version: ${{ version }}

source:
  url: https://github.com/westpa/${{ name }}/archive/refs/tags/v${{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: ${{ sha256 }}

build:
  number: 0
  skip: win
  script: ${{ PYTHON }} -m pip install . -vv --no-deps

requirements:
  build:
    - if: build_platform != target_platform
      then:
        - python
        - cross-python_${{ target_platform }}
        - cython >=0.29.16
        - numpy >=2.0.0,<3
    - ${{ compiler('c') }}
    - ${{ stdlib("c") }}
  host:
    - setuptools >=40.8.0
    - python
    - wheel
    - cython >=0.29.16
    - numpy >=2.0.0,<3
    - scipy >=0.19.1
    - versioneer-518
    - pip
  run:
    - python
    - numpy >=1.25.0,<3
    - scipy >=0.19.1
    - h5py >=2.10
    - mdtraj >=1.9.5
    - pyyaml >=5.3
    - pyzmq >=19.0
    - matplotlib-base
    - blessings 1.7.*
    - ipykernel
    - tqdm
    - pandas
    - pytables
    - if: match(python, "<3.11")  # Dependency fix for MDTraj 1.10.3
      then:
        - netCDF4

tests:
  - python:
      imports:
        - westpa
        - westpa.core.propagators
        - westpa.core.binning
        - westpa.core.kinetics
        - westpa.core.reweight
        - westpa.work_managers
        - westpa.tools
        - westpa.fasthist
        - westpa.mclib

about:
  license: MIT
  license_file: LICENSE
  summary: Interoperable, highly-scalable software for weighted ensemble simulation.
  description: |
    WESTPA is a package for constructing and running stochastic simulations
    using the "weighted ensemble" approach of Huber and Kim (1996).
  homepage: https://westpa.github.io/westpa
  repository: https://github.com/westpa
  documentation: https://westpa.readthedocs.io/en/latest/

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - mczwier
    - synapticarbors
    - burntyellow
    - ltchong
    - jeremyleung521
